intro: Galium innocuum, commonly known as small whitlowgrass, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium innocuum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common component of the understory vegetation in eastern North American forests.
